relation: Presence stuck in Away state after Idle followed by sleep/resume.

pageTitle: Release Notes for Cisco Jabber for Mac 8.6.x - Caveats [Cisco Jabber for Mac] - Cisco

textBeforeTable: The caveats in this table describe possible unexpected behavior in Cisco Jabber for Mac Release 8.6.7 when deployed in an on-demand environment. These caveats may also be open in previous releases. Release 8.6.7 Open caveats for Cisco Jabber for Mac (on-demand deployment) For more information about how to search for bugs, create saved searches, and create bug groups, click Help on the Bug Toolkit page. Enter the ID number in the Search for Bug ID field, and click Go to look for information about a specific problem. Sign in with your Cisco.com user ID and password. To access the Bug Toolkit, go to https:/​/​tools.cisco.com/​Bugsearch/​search. Procedure Cisco.com user ID and password Web browser Internet connection You can search for problems by using the Cisco Software Bug Toolkit. To access the Toolkit, you need these items: Before you begin All customer-found bugs Significant severity level 3 bugs
textAfterTable: CSCub77722 deskphone 3 Jabber crashes on updating EX90. CSCub56923 userinterface 3 Audio call using iLBC codec was modifed to G.729. CSCub56561 softphone 3 Music does not go on Hold when call is resumed after hold. CSCub43772 integr-conv-window 3 Retina:Tooltip for "Actions" icon in ICW disappears too soon. CSCuc06954 comp 3 Extreme slowness with desktop share happens with limited bandwidth. Release 8.6.4 The caveats in this table describe possible unexpected behavior in Cisco Jabber
